At Cordant Health Solutions®, we are made up of motivated and compassionate team members who are all part of the solution- that is the Cordant Way! Overview: We are looking for an enthusiastic Lab Tech to join our Flagstaff, AZ laboratory. Under direct supervision, the Lab Tech I will perform all operations within the specimen processing and data entry section of the lab while meeting quality and production expectations. We are looking for candidates who learn quickly and are comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. The schedule for this position is: Monday-Friday 5:45am- 3:15pm or 11:00am-7:30pm for 8hr shifts. or Monday-Friday 5:45am- 5:00pm or 11:00am-10:30pm for 10hr shifts. Schedule will change depending on volume. Starting pay is $18.00 per hour with an increase up to $18.50 after proficiency sign-off. Responsibilities: Performs routine operations including the opening of sample bags, creating accessions and batches, orders proper test(s), applies bar code stickers, and robotic aliquot after being signed off for the operations by the Team Lead Scans Chain of Custody (CoC) forms, assuring proper orientation and reproducible documents Determines if proper aliquot achieved; may be required to hand pour aliquots using bulb pipettes Separates out samples that require additional attention, including wet samples, oral fluids, not enough samples, etc. Keys in client and donor information noting any deficiencies after being signed off for the operation by the Team Lead May perform additional duties including transportation of batches to extractions (remove), pulling samples from freezer storage for additional testing, movement of samples to other areas, including frozen final storage or destruction, and similar tasks while assuring proper chain of custody Follows all laboratory policies and procedures; adheres to all health and safety standards Participates with company strategies including 5s, Lean, and the elimination of waste in our processes Qualifications: High School Diploma or equivalent Ability to interpret and follow complex, written instructions Strong attention to detail Ability to work independently as well as the ability to communicate effectively in a team environment Data entry skills via a keyboard (alpha and numeric) Strong hand-eye coordination Physical demands required to perform critical tasks in this role include standing for long periods of time, lifting up to 25lbs, bending and carrying #HP123 Benefits: About Cordant Health Solutions: Working at Cordant Health Solutions® means constantly being challenged to learn and grow in a fast-paced, dynamic, vibrant environment.
